description: Creates an Amazon OpenSearch Service domain. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Service domains.

parameters.name: DomainName
parameters.description: Name of the OpenSearch Service domain to create. Domain names are unique across the domains owned by an account within an Amazon Web Services Region.

parameters.name: ClusterConfig
parameters.description: Container for the cluster configuration of a domain. InstanceType (string) --- Instance type of data nodes in the cluster. InstanceCount (integer) --- Number of data nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 1, otherwise you receive a validation exception. DedicatedMasterEnabled (boolean) --- Indicates whether dedicated master nodes are enabled for the cluster. True if the cluster will use a dedicated master node. False if the cluster will not. ZoneAwarenessEnabled (boolean) --- Indicates whether multiple Availability Zones are enabled. For more information, see Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service. ZoneAwarenessConfig (dict) --- Container for zone awareness configuration options. Only required if ZoneAwarenessEnabled is true. AvailabilityZoneCount (integer) --- If you enabled multiple Availability Zones, this value is the number of zones that you want the domain to use. Valid values are 2 and 3. If your domain is provisioned within a VPC, this value be equal to number of subnets. DedicatedMasterType (string) --- OpenSearch Service instance type of the dedicated master nodes in the cluster. DedicatedMasterCount (integer) --- Number of dedicated master nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 2 and not 4, otherwise you receive a validation exception. WarmEnabled (boolean) --- Whether to enable warm storage for the cluster. WarmType (string) --- The instance type for the cluster's warm nodes. WarmCount (integer) --- The number of warm nodes in the cluster. ColdStorageOptions (dict) --- Container for cold storage configuration options. Whether to enable or disable cold storage on the domain. You must enable UltraWarm storage to enable cold storage. MultiAZWithStandbyEnabled (boolean) --- A boolean that indicates whether a multi-AZ domain is turned on with a standby AZ. NodeOptions (list) --- List of node options for the domain. (dict) --- Configuration settings for defining the node type within a cluster. NodeType (string) --- Defines the type of node, such as coordinating nodes. NodeConfig (dict) --- Configuration options for defining the setup of any node type. Enabled (boolean) --- A boolean value indicating whether a specific node type is active or inactive. Type (string) --- The instance type of a particular node within the cluster. Count (integer) --- The number of nodes of a specific type within the cluster.

nested_params.name: InstanceType
nested_params.description: Instance type of data nodes in the cluster.

nested_params.name: InstanceCount
nested_params.description: Number of data nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 1, otherwise you receive a validation exception.

nested_params.name: DedicatedMasterEnabled
nested_params.description: Indicates whether dedicated master nodes are enabled for the cluster. True if the cluster will use a dedicated master node. False if the cluster will not.

nested_params.name: ZoneAwarenessEnabled
nested_params.description: Indicates whether multiple Availability Zones are enabled. For more information, see Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_params.name: ZoneAwarenessConfig
nested_params.description: Container for zone awareness configuration options. Only required if ZoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

nested_params.name: AvailabilityZoneCount
nested_params.description: If you enabled multiple Availability Zones, this value is the number of zones that you want the domain to use. Valid values are 2 and 3. If your domain is provisioned within a VPC, this value be equal to number of subnets.

nested_params.name: DedicatedMasterType
nested_params.description: OpenSearch Service instance type of the dedicated master nodes in the cluster.

nested_params.name: DedicatedMasterCount
nested_params.description: Number of dedicated master nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 2 and not 4, otherwise you receive a validation exception.

nested_params.name: WarmEnabled
nested_params.description: Whether to enable warm storage for the cluster.

nested_params.name: WarmType
nested_params.description: The instance type for the cluster's warm nodes.

nested_params.name: WarmCount
nested_params.description: The number of warm nodes in the cluster.

nested_params.name: ColdStorageOptions
nested_params.description: Container for cold storage configuration options.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Whether to enable or disable cold storage on the domain. You must enable UltraWarm storage to enable cold storage.

nested_params.name: MultiAZWithStandbyEnabled
nested_params.description: A boolean that indicates whether a multi-AZ domain is turned on with a standby AZ. For more information, see Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_params.name: NodeOptions
nested_params.description: List of node options for the domain.

nested_params.name: NodeType
nested_params.description: Defines the type of node, such as coordinating nodes.

nested_params.name: NodeConfig
nested_params.description: Configuration options for defining the setup of any node type.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: A boolean value indicating whether a specific node type is active or inactive.

nested_params.name: Type
nested_params.description: The instance type of a particular node within the cluster.

nested_params.name: Count
nested_params.description: The number of nodes of a specific type within the cluster.

parameters.name: EBSOptions
parameters.description: Container for the parameters required to enable EBS-based storage for an OpenSearch Service domain. EBSEnabled (boolean) --- Indicates whether EBS volumes are attached to data nodes in an OpenSearch Service domain. VolumeType (string) --- Specifies the type of EBS volumes attached to data nodes. VolumeSize (integer) --- Specifies the size (in GiB) of EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Iops (integer) --- Specifies the baseline input/output (I/O) performance of EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 and provisioned IOPS EBS volume types. Throughput (integer) --- Specifies the throughput (in MiB/s) of the EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 volume type.

nested_params.name: EBSEnabled
nested_params.description: Indicates whether EBS volumes are attached to data nodes in an OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_params.name: VolumeType
nested_params.description: Specifies the type of EBS volumes attached to data nodes.

nested_params.name: VolumeSize
nested_params.description: Specifies the size (in GiB) of EBS volumes attached to data nodes.

nested_params.name: Iops
nested_params.description: Specifies the baseline input/output (I/O) performance of EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 and provisioned IOPS EBS volume types.

nested_params.name: Throughput
nested_params.description: Specifies the throughput (in MiB/s) of the EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 volume type.

parameters.name: SnapshotOptions
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. Container for the parameters required to configure automated snapshots of domain indexes. AutomatedSnapshotStartHour (integer) --- The time, in UTC format, when OpenSearch Service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.

nested_params.name: AutomatedSnapshotStartHour
nested_params.description: The time, in UTC format, when OpenSearch Service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.

parameters.name: VPCOptions
parameters.description: Container for the values required to configure VPC access domains. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Service creates the domain with a public endpoint. For more information, see Launching your Amazon OpenSearch Service domains using a VPC. SubnetIds (list) --- A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If your domain uses multiple Availability Zones, you need to provide two subnet IDs, one per zone. Otherwise, provide only one. (string) --- SecurityGroupIds (list) --- The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If you do not provide a security group ID, OpenSearch Service uses the default security group for the VPC. (string) ---

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If your domain uses multiple Availability Zones, you need to provide two subnet IDs, one per zone. Otherwise, provide only one.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_params.description: The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain. If you do not provide a security group ID, OpenSearch Service uses the default security group for the VPC.

parameters.name: CognitoOptions
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to configure Amazon Cognito authentication. For more information, see Configuring Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards. Enabled (boolean) --- Whether to enable or disable Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards. UserPoolId (string) --- The Amazon Cognito user pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication. IdentityPoolId (string) --- The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication. RoleArn (string) --- The AmazonOpenSearchServiceCognitoAccess role that allows OpenSearch Service to configure your user pool and identity pool.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Whether to enable or disable Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards.

nested_params.name: UserPoolId
nested_params.description: The Amazon Cognito user pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.

nested_params.name: IdentityPoolId
nested_params.description: The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The AmazonOpenSearchServiceCognitoAccess role that allows OpenSearch Service to configure your user pool and identity pool.

parameters.name: EncryptionAtRestOptions
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to enable encryption at rest. Enabled (boolean) --- True to enable encryption at rest. KmsKeyId (string) --- The KMS key ID. Takes the form 1a2a3a4-1a2a-3a4a-5a6a-1a2a3a4a5a6a.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: True to enable encryption at rest.

nested_params.name: KmsKeyId
nested_params.description: The KMS key ID. Takes the form 1a2a3a4-1a2a-3a4a-5a6a-1a2a3a4a5a6a.

parameters.name: NodeToNodeEncryptionOptions
parameters.description: Enables node-to-node encryption. Enabled (boolean) --- True to enable node-to-node encryption.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: True to enable node-to-node encryption.

parameters.name: AdvancedOptions
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to specify advanced configuration options. The following key-value pairs are supported: "rest.action.multi.allow_explicit_index": "true" | "false" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies whether explicit references to indexes are allowed inside the body of HTTP requests. If you want to configure access policies for domain sub-resources, such as specific indexes and domain APIs, you must disable this property. Default is true. "indices.fielddata.cache.size": "80" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies the percentage of heap space allocated to field data. Default is unbounded. "indices.query.bool.max_clause_count": "1024" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies the maximum number of clauses allowed in a Lucene boolean query. Default is 1,024. Queries with more than the permitted number of clauses result in a TooManyClauses error. "override_main_response_version": "true" | "false" - Note the use of a string rather than a boolean. Specifies whether the domain reports its version as 7.10 to allow Elasticsearch OSS clients and plugins to continue working with it. Default is false when creating a domain and true when upgrading a domain. For more information, see Advanced cluster parameters. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: LogPublishingOptions
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to configure log publishing. (string) --- The type of log file. Can be one of the following: INDEX_SLOW_LOGS - Index slow logs contain insert requests that took more time than the configured index query log threshold to execute. SEARCH_SLOW_LOGS - Search slow logs contain search queries that took more time than the configured search query log threshold to execute. ES_APPLICATION_LOGS - OpenSearch application logs contain information about errors and warnings raised during the operation of the service and can be useful for troubleshooting. AUDIT_LOGS - Audit logs contain records of user requests for access to the domain. (dict) --- Specifies whether the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain publishes the OpenSearch application and slow logs to Amazon CloudWatch. For more information, see Monitoring OpenSearch logs with Amazon CloudWatch Logs. CloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch Logs group to publish logs to. Enabled (boolean) --- Whether the log should be published.

parameters.name: DomainEndpointOptions
parameters.description: Additional options for the domain endpoint, such as whether to require HTTPS for all traffic. EnforceHTTPS (boolean) --- True to require that all traffic to the domain arrive over HTTPS. TLSSecurityPolicy (string) --- Specify the TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the domain. The policy can be one of the following values: Policy-Min-TLS-1-0-2019-07: TLS security policy that supports TLS version 1.0 to TLS version 1.2 Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-2019-07: TLS security policy that supports only TLS version 1.2 Policy-Min-TLS-1-2-PFS-2023-10: TLS security policy that supports TLS version 1.2 to TLS version 1.3 with perfect forward secrecy cipher suites CustomEndpointEnabled (boolean) --- Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain. CustomEndpoint (string) --- The fully qualified URL for the custom endpoint. CustomEndpointCertificateArn (string) --- The ARN for your security certificate, managed in Amazon Web Services Certificate Manager (ACM).

nested_params.name: EnforceHTTPS
nested_params.description: True to require that all traffic to the domain arrive over HTTPS.

nested_params.name: TLSSecurityPolicy
nested_params.description: Specify the TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the domain. The policy can be one of the following values:

nested_params.name: CustomEndpointEnabled
nested_params.description: Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain.

nested_params.name: CustomEndpoint
nested_params.description: The fully qualified URL for the custom endpoint.

nested_params.name: CustomEndpointCertificateArn
nested_params.description: The ARN for your security certificate, managed in Amazon Web Services Certificate Manager (ACM).

parameters.name: AdvancedSecurityOptions
parameters.description: Options for fine-grained access control. Enabled (boolean) --- True to enable fine-grained access control. InternalUserDatabaseEnabled (boolean) --- True to enable the internal user database. MasterUserOptions (dict) --- Container for information about the master user. MasterUserARN (string) --- Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is false. MasterUserName (string) --- User name for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is true. MasterUserPassword (string) --- Password for the master user. SAMLOptions (dict) --- Container for information about the SAML configuration for OpenSearch Dashboards. Enabled (boolean) --- True to enable SAML authentication for a domain. Idp (dict) --- The SAML Identity Provider's information. The metadata of the SAML application, in XML format. The unique entity ID of the application in the SAML identity provider. MasterUserName (string) --- The SAML master user name, which is stored in the domain's internal user database. MasterBackendRole (string) --- The backend role that the SAML master user is mapped to. SubjectKey (string) --- Element of the SAML assertion to use for the user name. Default is NameID. RolesKey (string) --- Element of the SAML assertion to use for backend roles. Default is roles. SessionTimeoutMinutes (integer) --- The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive. Acceptable values are between 1 and 1440, and the default value is 60. JWTOptions (dict) --- Container for information about the JWT configuration of the Amazon OpenSearch Service. Enabled (boolean) --- True to enable JWT authentication and authorization for a domain. SubjectKey (string) --- Element of the JWT assertion to use for the user name. RolesKey (string) --- Element of the JWT assertion to use for roles. PublicKey (string) --- Element of the JWT assertion used by the cluster to verify JWT signatures. AnonymousAuthEnabled (boolean) --- True to enable a 30-day migration period during which administrators can create role mappings. Only necessary when enabling fine-grained access control on an existing domain.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: True to enable fine-grained access control.

nested_params.name: InternalUserDatabaseEnabled
nested_params.description: True to enable the internal user database.

nested_params.name: MasterUserOptions
nested_params.description: Container for information about the master user.

nested_params.name: MasterUserARN
nested_params.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is false.

nested_params.name: MasterUserName
nested_params.description: User name for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is true.

nested_params.name: MasterUserPassword
nested_params.description: Password for the master user. Only specify if InternalUserDatabaseEnabled is true.

nested_params.name: SAMLOptions
nested_params.description: Container for information about the SAML configuration for OpenSearch Dashboards.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: True to enable SAML authentication for a domain.

nested_params.name: Idp
nested_params.description: The SAML Identity Provider's information.

nested_params.name: MetadataContent
nested_params.description: The metadata of the SAML application, in XML format.

nested_params.name: EntityId
nested_params.description: The unique entity ID of the application in the SAML identity provider.

nested_params.name: MasterUserName
nested_params.description: The SAML master user name, which is stored in the domain's internal user database.

nested_params.name: MasterBackendRole
nested_params.description: The backend role that the SAML master user is mapped to.

nested_params.name: SubjectKey
nested_params.description: Element of the SAML assertion to use for the user name. Default is NameID.

nested_params.name: RolesKey
nested_params.description: Element of the SAML assertion to use for backend roles. Default is roles.

nested_params.name: SessionTimeoutMinutes
nested_params.description: The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive. Acceptable values are between 1 and 1440, and the default value is 60.

nested_params.name: JWTOptions
nested_params.description: Container for information about the JWT configuration of the Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: True to enable JWT authentication and authorization for a domain.

nested_params.name: SubjectKey
nested_params.description: Element of the JWT assertion to use for the user name.

nested_params.name: RolesKey
nested_params.description: Element of the JWT assertion to use for roles.

nested_params.name: PublicKey
nested_params.description: Element of the JWT assertion used by the cluster to verify JWT signatures.

nested_params.name: AnonymousAuthEnabled
nested_params.description: True to enable a 30-day migration period during which administrators can create role mappings. Only necessary when enabling fine-grained access control on an existing domain.

parameters.name: IdentityCenterOptions
parameters.description: Configuration options for enabling and managing IAM Identity Center integration within a domain. EnabledAPIAccess (boolean) --- Indicates whether IAM Identity Center is enabled for API access in Amazon OpenSearch Service. IdentityCenterInstanceARN (string) --- The ARN of the IAM Identity Center instance used to create an OpenSearch UI application that uses IAM Identity Center for authentication. SubjectKey (string) --- Specifies the attribute that contains the subject identifier (such as username, user ID, or email) in IAM Identity Center. RolesKey (string) --- Specifies the attribute that contains the backend role identifier (such as group name or group ID) in IAM Identity Center.

nested_params.name: EnabledAPIAccess
nested_params.description: Indicates whether IAM Identity Center is enabled for API access in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_params.name: IdentityCenterInstanceARN
nested_params.description: The ARN of the IAM Identity Center instance used to create an OpenSearch UI application that uses IAM Identity Center for authentication.

nested_params.name: SubjectKey
nested_params.description: Specifies the attribute that contains the subject identifier (such as username, user ID, or email) in IAM Identity Center.

nested_params.name: RolesKey
nested_params.description: Specifies the attribute that contains the backend role identifier (such as group name or group ID) in IAM Identity Center.

parameters.name: TagList
parameters.description: List of tags to add to the domain upon creation. (dict) --- A tag (key-value pair) for an Amazon OpenSearch Service resource. The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the domain to which they are attached. The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the domain to which they are attached.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity.

parameters.name: AutoTuneOptions
parameters.description: Options for Auto-Tune. DesiredState (string) --- Whether Auto-Tune is enabled or disabled. MaintenanceSchedules (list) --- A list of maintenance schedules during which Auto-Tune can deploy changes. Maintenance windows are deprecated and have been replaced with off-peak windows. (dict) --- The Auto-Tune maintenance schedule. For more information, see Auto-Tune for Amazon OpenSearch Service. StartAt (datetime) --- The Epoch timestamp at which the Auto-Tune maintenance schedule starts. Duration (dict) --- The duration of the maintenance schedule. For example, "Duration": {"Value": 2, "Unit": "HOURS"}. Value (integer) --- Integer to specify the value of a maintenance schedule duration. Unit (string) --- The unit of measurement for the duration of a maintenance schedule. CronExpressionForRecurrence (string) --- A cron expression for a recurring maintenance schedule during which Auto-Tune can deploy changes. UseOffPeakWindow (boolean) --- Whether to schedule Auto-Tune optimizations that require blue/green deployments during the domain's configured daily off-peak window.

nested_params.name: DesiredState
nested_params.description: Whether Auto-Tune is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: MaintenanceSchedules
nested_params.description: A list of maintenance schedules during which Auto-Tune can deploy changes. Maintenance windows are deprecated and have been replaced with off-peak windows.

nested_params.name: StartAt
nested_params.description: The Epoch timestamp at which the Auto-Tune maintenance schedule starts.

nested_params.name: Duration
nested_params.description: The duration of the maintenance schedule. For example, "Duration": {"Value": 2, "Unit": "HOURS"}.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: Integer to specify the value of a maintenance schedule duration.

nested_params.name: Unit
nested_params.description: The unit of measurement for the duration of a maintenance schedule.

nested_params.name: CronExpressionForRecurrence
nested_params.description: A cron expression for a recurring maintenance schedule during which Auto-Tune can deploy changes.

nested_params.name: UseOffPeakWindow
nested_params.description: Whether to schedule Auto-Tune optimizations that require blue/green deployments during the domain's configured daily off-peak window.

parameters.name: OffPeakWindowOptions
parameters.description: Specifies a daily 10-hour time block during which OpenSearch Service can perform configuration changes on the domain, including service software updates and Auto-Tune enhancements that require a blue/green deployment. If no options are specified, the default start time of 10:00 P.M. local time (for the Region that the domain is created in) is used. Enabled (boolean) --- Whether to enable an off-peak window. This option is only available when modifying a domain created prior to February 16, 2023, not when creating a new domain. All domains created after this date have the off-peak window enabled by default. You can't disable the off-peak window after it's enabled for a domain. OffPeakWindow (dict) --- Off-peak window settings for the domain. WindowStartTime (dict) --- A custom start time for the off-peak window, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The window length will always be 10 hours, so you can't specify an end time. For example, if you specify 11:00 P.M. UTC as a start time, the end time will automatically be set to 9:00 A.M. The start hour of the window in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), using 24-hour time. For example, 17 refers to 5:00 P.M. UTC. The start minute of the window, in UTC.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Whether to enable an off-peak window. This option is only available when modifying a domain created prior to February 16, 2023, not when creating a new domain. All domains created after this date have the off-peak window enabled by default. You can't disable the off-peak window after it's enabled for a domain.

nested_params.name: OffPeakWindow
nested_params.description: Off-peak window settings for the domain.

nested_params.name: WindowStartTime
nested_params.description: A custom start time for the off-peak window, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The window length will always be 10 hours, so you can't specify an end time. For example, if you specify 11:00 P.M. UTC as a start time, the end time will automatically be set to 9:00 A.M.

nested_params.name: Hours
nested_params.description: The start hour of the window in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), using 24-hour time. For example, 17 refers to 5:00 P.M. UTC.

nested_params.name: Minutes
nested_params.description: The start minute of the window, in UTC.

parameters.name: SoftwareUpdateOptions
parameters.description: Software update options for the domain. AutoSoftwareUpdateEnabled (boolean) --- Whether automatic service software updates are enabled for the domain.

nested_params.name: AutoSoftwareUpdateEnabled
nested_params.description: Whether automatic service software updates are enabled for the domain.

parameters.name: AIMLOptions
parameters.description: Options for all machine learning features for the specified domain. NaturalLanguageQueryGenerationOptions (dict) --- Container for parameters required for natural language query generation on the specified domain. DesiredState (string) --- The desired state of the natural language query generation feature. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

nested_params.name: NaturalLanguageQueryGenerationOptions
nested_params.description: Container for parameters required for natural language query generation on the specified domain.

nested_params.name: DesiredState
nested_params.description: The desired state of the natural language query generation feature. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

nested_items.name: DomainStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the newly created domain.

nested_items.name: DomainId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the domain.

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: Name of the domain. Domain names are unique across all domains owned by the same account within an Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: ARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain. For more information, see IAM identifiers in the AWS Identity and Access Management User Guide.

nested_items.name: Created
nested_items.description: Creation status of an OpenSearch Service domain. True if domain creation is complete. False if domain creation is still in progress.

nested_items.name: Deleted
nested_items.description: Deletion status of an OpenSearch Service domain. True if domain deletion is complete. False if domain deletion is still in progress. Once deletion is complete, the status of the domain is no longer returned.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: Domain-specific endpoint used to submit index, search, and data upload requests to the domain.

nested_items.name: EndpointV2
nested_items.description: If IPAddressType to set to dualstack, a version 2 domain endpoint is provisioned. This endpoint functions like a normal endpoint, except that it works with both IPv4 and IPv6 IP addresses. Normal endpoints work only with IPv4 IP addresses.

nested_items.name: Endpoints
nested_items.description: The key-value pair that exists if the OpenSearch Service domain uses VPC endpoints. For example:

nested_items.name: DomainEndpointV2HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: The dual stack hosted zone ID for the domain.

nested_items.name: Processing
nested_items.description: The status of the domain configuration. True if OpenSearch Service is processing configuration changes. False if the configuration is active.

nested_items.name: UpgradeProcessing
nested_items.description: The status of a domain version upgrade to a new version of OpenSearch or Elasticsearch. True if OpenSearch Service is in the process of a version upgrade. False if the configuration is active.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Version of OpenSearch or Elasticsearch that the domain is running, in the format Elasticsearch_X.Y or OpenSearch_X.Y.

nested_items.name: ClusterConfig
nested_items.description: Container for the cluster configuration of the domain.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Instance type of data nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: Number of data nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 1, otherwise you receive a validation exception.

nested_items.name: DedicatedMasterEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether dedicated master nodes are enabled for the cluster. True if the cluster will use a dedicated master node. False if the cluster will not.

nested_items.name: ZoneAwarenessEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether multiple Availability Zones are enabled. For more information, see Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_items.name: ZoneAwarenessConfig
nested_items.description: Container for zone awareness configuration options. Only required if ZoneAwarenessEnabled is true.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneCount
nested_items.description: If you enabled multiple Availability Zones, this value is the number of zones that you want the domain to use. Valid values are 2 and 3. If your domain is provisioned within a VPC, this value be equal to number of subnets.

nested_items.name: DedicatedMasterType
nested_items.description: OpenSearch Service instance type of the dedicated master nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: DedicatedMasterCount
nested_items.description: Number of dedicated master nodes in the cluster. This number must be greater than 2 and not 4, otherwise you receive a validation exception.

nested_items.name: WarmEnabled
nested_items.description: Whether to enable warm storage for the cluster.

nested_items.name: WarmType
nested_items.description: The instance type for the cluster's warm nodes.

nested_items.name: WarmCount
nested_items.description: The number of warm nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: ColdStorageOptions
nested_items.description: Container for cold storage configuration options.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Whether to enable or disable cold storage on the domain. You must enable UltraWarm storage to enable cold storage.

nested_items.name: MultiAZWithStandbyEnabled
nested_items.description: A boolean that indicates whether a multi-AZ domain is turned on with a standby AZ. For more information, see Configuring a multi-AZ domain in Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_items.name: NodeOptions
nested_items.description: List of node options for the domain.

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: Defines the type of node, such as coordinating nodes.

nested_items.name: NodeConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration options for defining the setup of any node type.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: A boolean value indicating whether a specific node type is active or inactive.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The instance type of a particular node within the cluster.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of nodes of a specific type within the cluster.

nested_items.name: EBSOptions
nested_items.description: Container for EBS-based storage settings for the domain.

nested_items.name: EBSEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether EBS volumes are attached to data nodes in an OpenSearch Service domain.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of EBS volumes attached to data nodes.

nested_items.name: VolumeSize
nested_items.description: Specifies the size (in GiB) of EBS volumes attached to data nodes.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: Specifies the baseline input/output (I/O) performance of EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 and provisioned IOPS EBS volume types.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: Specifies the throughput (in MiB/s) of the EBS volumes attached to data nodes. Applicable only for the gp3 volume type.

nested_items.name: AccessPolicies
nested_items.description: Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy document specifying the access policies for the domain.

nested_items.name: IPAddressType
nested_items.description: The type of IP addresses supported by the endpoint for the domain.

nested_items.name: SnapshotOptions
nested_items.description: DEPRECATED. Container for parameters required to configure automated snapshots of domain indexes.

nested_items.name: AutomatedSnapshotStartHour
nested_items.description: The time, in UTC format, when OpenSearch Service takes a daily automated snapshot of the specified domain. Default is 0 hours.

nested_items.name: VPCOptions
nested_items.description: The VPC configuration for the domain.

nested_items.name: VPCId
nested_items.description: The ID for your VPC. Amazon VPC generates this value when you create a VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: The list of Availability Zones associated with the VPC subnets.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The list of security group IDs associated with the VPC endpoints for the domain.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CognitoOptions
nested_items.description: Key-value pairs to configure Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Whether to enable or disable Amazon Cognito authentication for OpenSearch Dashboards.

nested_items.name: UserPoolId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Cognito user pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.

nested_items.name: IdentityPoolId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Cognito identity pool ID that you want OpenSearch Service to use for OpenSearch Dashboards authentication.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The AmazonOpenSearchServiceCognitoAccess role that allows OpenSearch Service to configure your user pool and identity pool.

nested_items.name: EncryptionAtRestOptions
nested_items.description: Encryption at rest settings for the domain.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: True to enable encryption at rest.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key ID. Takes the form 1a2a3a4-1a2a-3a4a-5a6a-1a2a3a4a5a6a.

nested_items.name: NodeToNodeEncryptionOptions
nested_items.description: Whether node-to-node encryption is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: True to enable node-to-node encryption.

nested_items.name: AdvancedOptions
nested_items.description: Key-value pairs that specify advanced configuration options.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogPublishingOptions
nested_items.description: Log publishing options for the domain.

nested_items.name: INDEX_SLOW_LOGS
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: ServiceSoftwareOptions
nested_items.description: The current status of the domain's service software.

nested_items.name: CurrentVersion
nested_items.description: The current service software version present on the domain.

nested_items.name: NewVersion
nested_items.description: The new service software version, if one is available.

nested_items.name: UpdateAvailable
nested_items.description: True if you're able to update your service software version. False if you can't update your service software version.

nested_items.name: Cancellable
nested_items.description: True if you're able to cancel your service software version update. False if you can't cancel your service software update.

nested_items.name: UpdateStatus
nested_items.description: The status of your service software update.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the service software update status.

nested_items.name: AutomatedUpdateDate
nested_items.description: The timestamp, in Epoch time, until which you can manually request a service software update. After this date, we automatically update your service software.

nested_items.name: OptionalDeployment
nested_items.description: True if a service software is never automatically updated. False if a service software is automatically updated after the automated update date.

nested_items.name: DomainEndpointOptions
nested_items.description: Additional options for the domain endpoint, such as whether to require HTTPS for all traffic.

nested_items.name: EnforceHTTPS
nested_items.description: True to require that all traffic to the domain arrive over HTTPS.

nested_items.name: TLSSecurityPolicy
nested_items.description: Specify the TLS security policy to apply to the HTTPS endpoint of the domain. The policy can be one of the following values:

nested_items.name: CustomEndpointEnabled
nested_items.description: Whether to enable a custom endpoint for the domain.

nested_items.name: CustomEndpoint
nested_items.description: The fully qualified URL for the custom endpoint.

nested_items.name: CustomEndpointCertificateArn
nested_items.description: The ARN for your security certificate, managed in Amazon Web Services Certificate Manager (ACM).

nested_items.name: AdvancedSecurityOptions
nested_items.description: Settings for fine-grained access control.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: True if fine-grained access control is enabled.

nested_items.name: InternalUserDatabaseEnabled
nested_items.description: True if the internal user database is enabled.

nested_items.name: SAMLOptions
nested_items.description: Container for information about the SAML configuration for OpenSearch Dashboards.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: True if SAML is enabled.

nested_items.name: MetadataContent
nested_items.description: The metadata of the SAML application, in XML format.

nested_items.name: EntityId
nested_items.description: The unique entity ID of the application in the SAML identity provider.

nested_items.name: SubjectKey
nested_items.description: The key used for matching the SAML subject attribute.

nested_items.name: RolesKey
nested_items.description: The key used for matching the SAML roles attribute.

nested_items.name: SessionTimeoutMinutes
nested_items.description: The duration, in minutes, after which a user session becomes inactive.

nested_items.name: JWTOptions
nested_items.description: Container for information about the JWT configuration of the Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: True if JWT use is enabled.

nested_items.name: SubjectKey
nested_items.description: The key used for matching the JWT subject attribute.

nested_items.name: RolesKey
nested_items.description: The key used for matching the JWT roles attribute.

nested_items.name: PublicKey
nested_items.description: The key used to verify the signature of incoming JWT requests.

nested_items.name: AnonymousAuthDisableDate
nested_items.description: Date and time when the migration period will be disabled. Only necessary when enabling fine-grained access control on an existing domain.

nested_items.name: AnonymousAuthEnabled
nested_items.description: True if a 30-day migration period is enabled, during which administrators can create role mappings. Only necessary when enabling fine-grained access control on an existing domain.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterOptions
nested_items.description: Configuration options for controlling IAM Identity Center integration within a domain.

nested_items.name: EnabledAPIAccess
nested_items.description: Indicates whether IAM Identity Center is enabled for the application.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterInstanceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Identity Center instance.

nested_items.name: SubjectKey
nested_items.description: Specifies the attribute that contains the subject identifier (such as username, user ID, or email) in IAM Identity Center.

nested_items.name: RolesKey
nested_items.description: Specifies the attribute that contains the backend role identifier (such as group name or group ID) in IAM Identity Center.

nested_items.name: IdentityCenterApplicationARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM Identity Center application that integrates with Amazon OpenSearch Service.

nested_items.name: IdentityStoreId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the IAM Identity Store.

nested_items.name: AutoTuneOptions
nested_items.description: Auto-Tune settings for the domain.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of Auto-Tune on the domain.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: Any errors that occurred while enabling or disabling Auto-Tune.

nested_items.name: UseOffPeakWindow
nested_items.description: Whether the domain's off-peak window will be used to deploy Auto-Tune changes rather than a maintenance schedule.

nested_items.name: ChangeProgressDetails
nested_items.description: Information about a configuration change happening on the domain.

nested_items.name: ChangeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the configuration change.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A message corresponding to the status of the configuration change.

nested_items.name: ConfigChangeStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the configuration change.

nested_items.name: InitiatedBy
nested_items.description: The IAM principal who initiated the configuration change.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time that the configuration change was initiated, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The last time that the configuration change was updated.

nested_items.name: OffPeakWindowOptions
nested_items.description: Options that specify a custom 10-hour window during which OpenSearch Service can perform configuration changes on the domain.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Whether to enable an off-peak window.

nested_items.name: OffPeakWindow
nested_items.description: Off-peak window settings for the domain.

nested_items.name: WindowStartTime
nested_items.description: A custom start time for the off-peak window, in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The window length will always be 10 hours, so you can't specify an end time. For example, if you specify 11:00 P.M. UTC as a start time, the end time will automatically be set to 9:00 A.M.

nested_items.name: Hours
nested_items.description: The start hour of the window in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), using 24-hour time. For example, 17 refers to 5:00 P.M. UTC.

nested_items.name: Minutes
nested_items.description: The start minute of the window, in UTC.

nested_items.name: SoftwareUpdateOptions
nested_items.description: Service software update options for the domain.

nested_items.name: AutoSoftwareUpdateEnabled
nested_items.description: Whether automatic service software updates are enabled for the domain.

nested_items.name: DomainProcessingStatus
nested_items.description: The status of any changes that are currently in progress for the domain.

nested_items.name: ModifyingProperties
nested_items.description: Information about the domain properties that are currently being modified.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the property that is currently being modified.

nested_items.name: ActiveValue
nested_items.description: The current value of the domain property that is being modified.

nested_items.name: PendingValue
nested_items.description: The value that the property that is currently being modified will eventually have.

nested_items.name: ValueType
nested_items.description: The type of value that is currently being modified. Properties can have two types:
PLAIN_TEXT: Contain direct values such as '1', 'True', or 'c5.large.search'.
STRINGIFIED_JSON: Contain content in JSON format, such as {'Enabled':'True'}'.

nested_items.name: AIMLOptions
nested_items.description: Container for parameters required to enable all machine learning features.

nested_items.name: NaturalLanguageQueryGenerationOptions
nested_items.description: Container for parameters required for natural language query generation on the specified domain.

nested_items.name: DesiredState
nested_items.description: The desired state of the natural language query generation feature. Valid values are ENABLED and DISABLED.

nested_items.name: CurrentState
nested_items.description: The current state of the natural language query generation feature, indicating completion, in progress, or failure.
